result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

filed by Atty Amaro Lopez

Defendant received copy of information.

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:30 PM Defendant Mario Cesar Diaz Martinez in court.  Attorney Amaro Lopez in court for Mario Cesar Diaz Martinez.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Interpreter, Susan Rascon, appears in person.

3:31 p.m.  Interpreter is sworn in.
Defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary examination.
Atty Lopez makes statements and he states that a waiver had been signed.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

1:16 PM Defendant Mario Cesar Diaz Martinez in court, in custody. Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner is present in Court for the Defendant.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Enrique Soria is present and sworn in to interpret.
ADA Andrew Mutchler states facts for anticipated charges of Delivery of Cocaine. 
Atty Bergner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Defendant at this time does not qualify for a public defender.
State requests a $2,500 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner states his objections as to bond and requests a signature bond. 
BY THE COURT:
22CT11 Warrant is quashed and bond is set for $250 signature bond. Do not operate Motor Vehicle without a valid Drivers License. (Initial appearance 05-02-2022 @ 1:15 pm)
Cash Bond is set on 22GF162.
